definition: to cancel out a crime/to receive punishment as a scapegoat
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
variant of 罪[zui4], crime
guilt/crime/fault/blame/sin
scapegoat
scapegoat/sacrificial lamb/same as 替罪羊

sentences.english: Eliminating problem by transferring the blame to others is often called scape-goating.
sentences.chinese: 消除问题靠转移指责给别人常常被叫做替罪羊现象。

sentences.english: But I suspect that the nuclearweapon is only the scapegoat for our fears.
sentences.chinese: 但我怀疑，核武器不过是我们害怕的替罪羊。

sentences.english: Eliminating problems by transferring the blame to ananpeople else is frequently cwhichleed scape-goating.
sentences.chinese: 用怪罪别人的技巧来解决疑难通常被称为找寻替罪羊。

sentences.english: Eliminating problems by transferring the blame to others is often called scape-goating. 21.
sentences.chinese: 用责备别人的方法来办理题目凡是被称为寻找替罪羊。

sentences.english: Don't you think he is only a whipping-boy?
sentences.chinese: 难道你不认为他只是个替罪羊吗？

sentences.english: The gang ran off and left their lookout as a fall guy.
sentences.chinese: 那伙人逃跑了，让他们的守望员当了替罪羊。

sentences.english: They were made the scapegoats for the misfire of the program.
sentences.chinese: 他们成了那个计划失败的替罪羊。

sentences.english: China’s export engine once again looks like an appealing scapegoat.
sentences.chinese: 中国的出口贸易有可能会再次成为替罪羊。

sentences.english: Obama would do well to avoid such scapegoating.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马将会做得更好，不会成为那样的替罪羊。

sentences.english: German leaders, meanwhile, warned against anti-migrant scapegoating.
sentences.chinese: 然而德国领导人却警告说，不要把移民当做替罪羊。

sentences.english: And everybody looked around for somebody to blame.
The gang ran off and left their lookout at a fall guy.
sentences.chinese: 那伙人逃跑了，让他们守望员当了替罪羊。

sentences.english: Chinese officials say Washington is simply searching for a scapegoat.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府认为，美国只是在寻找一个替罪羔羊而已。

sentences.english: Identifying scapegoats and inciting others to castigate them.
sentences.chinese: 指定替罪羔羊，煽动其他人鞭挞他们。

sentences.english: He had been made the scapegoat for all the failures of the Luftwaffe.
sentences.chinese: 他就是德国空军各次败绩的替罪羊。

sentences.english: He clamed he had been made a scapegoat for the administration's failures.
sentences.chinese: 他声称自己成了行政管理失败的替罪羊。

definition: scapegoat/sacrificial lamb/same as 替罪羊
to redeem oneself/to make up for one's misdeeds
scapegoat
scapegoat/fall guy
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
to take the blame for sb else/to be made a scapegoat
to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others/to pass the buck
sinner
guilt
to mastermind/to orchestrate/to instigate/mastermind/instigator
to take the blame/to be a scapegoat/to carry the can
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to conspire with sb/to plot/a conspirator/a partner in crime/an accomplice
accomplice/accessory
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
